Idaho veterans and their families have provided 1,498 collections for the VHP so far.  The personal service accounts of Idaho veterans and veterans nationwide can be viewed on the Veterans History Project website, at https://t.co/lD6hRIQcDh.
In 2016, Congress expanded the Veterans History Project to include stories given by immediate family of Armed Forces members lost through wartime service.

Congress established the Veterans History Project in 2000.  Since, the Library of Congress’ American Folklife Center has been working with the public to collect veterans’ oral histories to preserve and make them available to the public.
